channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump again threatens Harvard's tax-exempt status, saying, 'It's what they deserve!'
item.description: Trump's comments on social media marked the latest volley in a battle between the administration and the wealthiest college in the world.

item.title: The U.S. job market cooled slightly as Trump's trade war heated up
item.description: U.S. employers added 177,000 jobs in April — a modest slowdown from the previous month, while the unemployment rate held steady at 4.2%.

item.title: Trump orders end of NPR's federal funding. And, judge blocks use of Alien Enemies Act
item.description: Trump signed an executive order to end federal funding for NPR and PBS, accusing the organizations of political bias. And, a federal judge ruled Trump...

item.title: Trump cuts demolish agency focused on toxic chemicals and workplace hazards
item.description: The Trump administration has decimated an agency responsible for carrying out much of the research and prevention efforts to curb exposure to dangerou...

item.title: Trump is proposing Congress cut $163 billion in non-defense spending next year
item.description: These proposed cuts are to programs that Congress authorizes each year — not to spending on safety nets like Medicare, Medicaid and Social Security. M...

item.title: A loophole expires Friday. Here's what that means for shoppers.
item.description: Cheaper goods from China are no longer exempt from import duties, which could sharply raise points for consumers.

item.title: Shein and Temu prices to rise as US closes small parcel loophole
item.description: The online marketplace says it will move to a "local fulfillment model" in the US, with sales handled by locally based sellers.

item.title: Anger as Uganda president's son says he's holding opposition bodyguard
item.description: The bodyguard of opposition leader Bobi Wine went missing five days ago, leading to fears for his safety.

item.title: Earthquake, tsunami warning off coast of Chile and Argentina
item.description: A 7.4 magnitude earthquake struck off the southern coasts of Chile and Argentina on Friday, the United States Geological Survey said.

item.title: Student murdered by ex thought she was meeting him one last time
item.description: Catina Salarno's sister, Nina Salarno, became a prosecutor in California to warn others about a common tactic abusers use.

item.title: AfD classified as extreme-right by German intelligence
item.description: The AfD came second in Germany's February elections and has a record number of seats in the new parliament.

item.title: South African woman guilty of kidnapping and trafficking daughter aged 6
item.description: Joshlin Smith's disappearance last year sent shockwaves across South Africa. She is yet to be found.

item.title: 5/2: CBS Morning News
item.description: Mike Waltz out as national security adviser, tapped for U.N. ambassador; NASA astronauts perform 5th-ever all-female spacewalk.

item.title: 2 arrested over murders of mom, son searching for missing relative
item.description: Maria del Carmen Morales and her son were shot dead last week. They had been searching for another son who went missing last year.

item.title: Chile issues tsunami warning after earthquake
item.description: The warning is issued for parts of the remote Magallanes region after a 7.4 magnitude earthquake strikes off the coast.

item.title: Justice Department sues Hawaii, Michigan over plans to sue fossil fuel companies for climate harm
item.description: The Justice Department is suing two states over their planned lawsuits against fossil fuel companies for harms caused by climate change.

item.title: The Justice Department ended a decades-old school desegregation order. Others are expected to fall
Trump’s health agency urges therapy for transgender youth, not broader gender-affirming health care
